relevant_findings.tumors: Elevated, whitish-grey, semitransparent tumor adjacent to optic disc with two more opaque white equatorial tumors visible at 10-o'clock and 12 o'clock

relevant_findings.irradiation_effects: Developed proliferative radiation retinopathy with cotton-wool spots, cystoid macular edema, and intraretinal and vitreous hemorrhages

relevant_findings.VA: 1.0 after treatment of vitreous hemorrhages and cryotherapy

relevant_findings.appearance: Identified two new equatorial retinoblastomas at the 9-o'clock position

relevant_findings.pseudohypopyon: First seen below the limbus, with 5 new retinal tumors

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: IOP increased to 28 mmHg with a subsequent eye tap showing retinoblastoma cells

relevant_findings.accumulation: Elschnig's pearls increased and were difficult to differentiate from tumor particles

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Seen growth on optic disc and hemorrhages visible

relevant_findings.appearance: Increasing irradiation retinopathy with marked narrowing of retinal arterioles

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Retinoblastoma cells began to grow on the corneal endothelium
